title: command db compact not working with ancient blocks
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `1.10.8`
OS & Version: Linux / debian 10

#### Expected behaviour
command
`geth db compact --datadir.ancient /path/to/ancient` should work, OR it should not require `--datadir.ancient` parameter.

#### Actual behaviour

command `geth db compact` crashes and complains that `datadir.ancient` is not provided.
command `geth db compact --datadir.ancient /path/to/ancient` crashes and complains that `datadir.ancient` is not supported parameter

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

1. Make sure you are running node with `datadir.ancient` in different place
2. Attempt to compact the database

#### Backtrace
(parameter verbousity does not work with `db compact` command, so I cannot set it to 5)
````
root@ChainServer /etc/systemd/system # /usr/bin/geth db compact --mainnet --cache 8192
INFO [10-20|12:35:25.699] Maximum peer count                       ETH=50 LES=0 total=50
INFO [10-20|12:35:25.700] Smartcard socket not found, disabling    err="stat /run/pcscd/pcscd.comm: no such file or directory"
INFO [10-20|12:35:25.701] Set global gas cap                       cap=50,000,000
INFO [10-20|12:35:25.721] Allocated cache and file handles         database=/root/.ethereum/geth/chaindata cache=4.00GiB handles=524,288
INFO [10-20|12:35:31.400] Opened ancient database                  database=/root/.ethereum/geth/chaindata/ancient readonly=false
Fatal: Could not open database: ancient chain segments already extracted, please set --datadir.ancient to the correct path

root@ChainServer /etc/systemd/system # /usr/bin/geth db compact --mainnet --cache 8192 --datadir.ancient /storage/go-ethereum-mainnet-freezer
Incorrect Usage: flag provided but not defined: -datadir.ancient

compact [command options] 
This command performs a database compaction. 
WARNING: This operation may take a very long time to finish, and may cause database
corruption if it is aborted during execution'!

ETHEREUM OPTIONS:
                                      --datadir value                       Data directory for the databases and keystore (default: "/root/.ethereum")
                                      --syncmode value                      Blockchain sync mode ("fast", "full", "snap" or "light") (default: snap)
                                      --mainnet                             Ethereum mainnet
                                      --ropsten                             Ropsten network: pre-configured proof-of-work test network
                                      --rinkeby                             Rinkeby network: pre-configured proof-of-authority test network
                                      --goerli                              GÃ¶rli network: pre-configured proof-of-authority test network

PERFORMANCE TUNING OPTIONS:
                                      --cache value                         Megabytes of memory allocated to internal caching (default = 4096 mainnet full node, 128 light mode) (default: 1024)
                                      --cache.database value                Percentage of cache memory allowance to use for database io (default: 50)

flag provided but not defined: -datadir.ancient
root@ChainServer /etc/systemd/system # 
````

When submitting logs: please submit them as text and not screenshots.

Yeah it's a bit UX-unfriendly, but place those before the command `db`: 
```
geth --datadir.ancient /tmp/foo --datadir /tmp/bar db compact
INFO [10-20|13:24:05.455] Maximum peer count                       ETH=50 LES=0 total=50
INFO [10-20|13:24:05.455] Smartcard socket not found, disabling    err="stat /run/pcscd/pcscd.comm: no such file or directory"
INFO [10-20|13:24:05.456] Set global gas cap                       cap=50,000,000
INFO [10-20|13:24:05.456] Allocated cache and file handles         database=/tmp/bar/geth/chaindata cache=512.00MiB handles=262,144
INFO [10-20|13:24:05.459] Opened ancient database                  database=/tmp/foo                readonly=false
```
